Ground state depletion microscopy.EditorialNote: Trying to consolidate the assay and protocol branch, as it leads to unnecessary duplication.  Decided to go with protocol
Ground state depletion microscopy.Definition: A type of microscopy that uses the triplet state of a fluorophore as the off-state and the singlet state as the on-state, whereby an excitation laser is used to drive the fluorophores at the periphery of the singlet state molecule to the triplet state. (adapted from Wikipedia:  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Super-resolution_microscopy#Ground_state_depletion_.28GSD.29)
